3.3.Title: 3.3 Neighbors Table
Rows: (Roll on the race chart page 7, add 1 additional settlement)

4.1.Title: 4.1 Age of Discovery Table
Rows: Something magical, powerful, or otherworldly has been discovered. Describe and draw this relic, be sure to give it and the location where it was discovered a name. (ex. Tome of undeath, wand of power, divine weapon)
Sinister forces are lurking. Is it demons, twisted abominations, giant spiders? Draw in this new hostile neighbor with an appropriate settlement

Your sea explorers have discovered a new island! Draw in 1 small island, roll on the geography table pg 5 twice and place on or near new island, then name the island after the explorer that discovered it.
Your scouts discovered the ruins of a lost civilization. Draw in a ruin and place a new cult, hive, mage, or tribe nearby.
Select a neighbor at random and roll on the appropriate Neighbors Develop Table on page 13
Brigands have been raiding merchants and caravans. Place a new hostile camp on a trade route or bay, then give them a name and banner.
Scouts have discovered another kingdom! Roll on the Race table pg 7, then place 2 settlements. Remember to give them a banner and a name!
Your empire is growing to distant shores. Build a new coastal settlement on the same or nearby island.
Your empire is growing. Place a new settlement - Roll on the settlement table on the previous page 3.4
Your explorers have made contact with hostiles. Roll on the Neighbors Table pg 9 and place them anywhere in your home region. Use the Race Table & Settlement Table pg 9 if necessary
Your empire is flexing it's might, draw in a new military settlement nearby
Choose one neighboring faction and add a new settlement for them.
Your Explorers have discovered a valuable new resource! Place a new resource symbol in your home region

Scouts have stumbled upon an impressive landmark, is it a strange rock formation, a lone monolith, magical grove? Draw it in then place a tribe nearby - roll on the Race Table pg 7 and place a settlement
Strange and magnificent beasts have been spotted. Are they terrifyingly large, aggressive, tasty? Draw in a symbol and name for these new creatures.
Your scouts have disturbed and awakened a legendary monster, draw in a new monster and give it a name. ex: The Onyx Dragon, Titan of the North, Swamp Hydra

5.1.Title: 5.1 Age of Empires Table
Rows: Your king/leader has died without a proper heir and now your empire is in anarchy. Split your empire into at least 3 factions, creating new names/banners for each. If you wish you may switch your Prime Faction now.
One of your settlements has grown tired of your rule and thrown out the ruling class. Rename this new “free” city and give the new faction a name and banner.
A nearby location has come to be seen as sacred grounds to your people. Place a shrine or temple and select the deity worshiped here (choose one already made or create a new one from Era II - pg 5)
A powerful hero has shown up in the Empire, what did they do? Draw in a statue, monument, or name a geography near your capital or the location of the event.
A nearby hostile force has attacked! destroy a fort or settlement and replace it with a ruin, or claim it for the nearby invading faction.
Your army is marching! Select any settlement not already owned by you and roll on the War! Table pg 16 with your empire acting as the Attacker.
Select a neighbor at random and roll on the appropriate Neighbors Develop Table on the next page 5.2
A fleet of ships or military caravan has set out to gain a foothold in distant lands. Place a new coastal fort or frontier outpost, preferably in another’s home region.
Your empire is growing, Roll on the settlement table pg 9 and place a new settlement anywhere on the map

People are flocking to your empire. Grow your cities if possible, add more farmland, draw ships in the ports, etc. Then draw in a monument or construction to show off your wealth. Name a nearby geography after the leader

Economic Prosperity! Build a road connecting your empire to another faction, then add a trade post somewhere along the road. (consider resource locations) If no possible road connections exist, build a new coastal trade post.
Your empire needs stability & security. Create a fort, city/border walls, or a barracks
Your empire has cultivated a new craft, art, or ability. Are they spellcasters, researchers, monks, druids? Build a new academy, sanctuary, or library for this group and place this new settlement.
Something terrible has struck the empire. Natural Disaster or Magical, famine or disease? Remove a settlement and replace it with a ruin.
Your growing empire needs food! Place either a new farming town or fishing village
Rebellion! Half your empire has split into a new faction. Give them a name +banner, treat them as a hostile neighbor from now on.

5.2.1.Title: 5.2 Minor Faction Table
Rows: Draw in a new fort or military settlement
Select a nearby tribe and merge them into the minor faction, becoming one nation.
A new academy, altar, tower? Draw in a new construction
Connect a road to a neighbor and build a trade settlement on that road. Or,create a new coastal trading port.

5.2.2.Title: 5.2 Tribe / Bandits / Pirates Table
Rows: A new Legendary Monster has been discovered. Create one now and draw it in
War! Select a neighbor and roll on the War! Table pg 16
Strong leadership has taken control of the tribe. Upgrade to a Minor Faction by giving a banner and name.
Strap some ships together and create a floating village in a nearby sea or lake
A mighty leader has mustered together enough force to attack and take a town. Take one nearby settlement and switch control to the tribe.

5.2.3.Title: 5.2 Hive Table
Rows: A new queen has taken a large group to settle a new hive, place a new Hive somewhere else on the map.
Add a new hive settlement/den/nest nearby
Attack a nearby settlement, roll 1d6 for result Odd = settlement destroyed , Even = town defended
Attack and replace a nearby settlement with a new nest/settlement of the hive.
The hive has bred an incredible new foe. Create a new Legendary Monster
Add a new hive settlement/den/nest nearby

5.2.4.Title: 5.2 Magic User Table
Rows: A group of followers has joined. Build a settlement camp nearby.
Attack a nearby settlement, roll 1d6 Odd = settlement destroyed , Even = town defended
Followers are flocking to the power (choice or force?), build a new resource camp settlement nearby.
A monolith, shrine, or portal? Draw in a new construction.
Eternal winter, forest grow, burned lands? Alter the lands nearby by adding a geography or destroying part of one.
Foul or corrupted magic is tainting the land. Darken the land, kill the forests, or spoil the water supplies nearby.

5.2.5.Title: 5.2 Cult / Lair / Order Table
Rows: Draw a new Temple nearby and select a deity or create a new one
A new dungeon, tower, altar to a god? Draw in a new construction nearby
The Cult has taken control of a nearby settlement, switch faction control to the cult
A nearby settlement has something valuable (gems, weapons, people) draw in a camp nearby and describe the theft.

5.2.6.Title: 5.2 Monster Table
Rows: Attack a nearby settlement, roll 1d6 Odd = settlement destroyed , Even = town defended
Whether by offering, sacrifice, or assault, the monster has accumulated vast amounts of wealth. Draw in a treasure hold or gold laden lair.
Attack a nearby settlement, roll 1d6 Odd = settlement destroyed , Even = town defended
Fantastic stories are being spread about the monster. Add it to the list of gods and select a domain and symbol for it (give it a name if you haven’t yet)
The monster is settling in, they or their followers are creating a proper lair or den. Draw in a home, cave, tower, or sanctum.
The monster has unleashed its rage onto a nearby settlement, destroy and replace it with a ruin

6.1.Title: 6.1 Age of Collapse Table
Rows: A Monster has risen from underground and destroyed or claimed one of your settlements. Place a new monster on the map now (don’t forget a name)
Has a portal to a new realm opened, or perhaps a mad wizard has crafted a new tower? Describe & draw in a magical occurrence, anything from a new tower to a massive crater.
Your rulers need a place to live! Build a palace for them near the capital or somewhere of importance. Name this region on the map after the ruling family
A religion has gained prominence in the empire. Select a deity (or create a new one) and place a cathedral or large temple nearby
People are flocking to your city, are they fleeing war, monster attacks, disasters? Place a small village next to or expand your capital for these new citizens.
Despite the times, your empire is thriving! Roll & draw in a new settlement or expand your existing one with farmland, walls, etc.
Select any two neighboring factions, choose which is the attacker and defender, then roll on the War! Table pg 16

Your army is marching! Select any settlement not already owned by you and roll on the War! Table pg 16 with your empire acting as the Attacker. (this can be against any faction, tribe, or hostile force on the map)
Select a neighbor at random and roll on the appropriate Neighbors Develop Table on the previous page pg 13
Draw in a new fort or military settlement

Something terrible has struck the empire. Natural Disaster or Magical, famine or disease? Roll 1 dice to determine the severity (6 is most severe, 1 is weak) - Remove at least 1 settlement and replace it with a ruin.
Something sinister has claimed a nearby ruin. Place a new cult, tribe, mage, hive, or monster onto the map on an existing ruin. (if no empty ruin exists, find an empty place on the map for them)
A neighboring faction has joined your empire. Create an Alliance Banner and give your new united empire a name.
Rebellion! Half your empire has split into a new faction. Give them a name + banner, treat them as a hostile neighbor from now on

Something fowl is lurking in the forest (or any geography) is it lycanthropy, demonic spiders, a mad druid, rodents of unusual size? Treat them as a hostile faction and give the location an ominous name (ex: Forest of Death, Smouldering Jungle, Fire Swamp)
Total devastation! Something apocalyptic has struck your home region, island destroyed, comet impact, fury of the gods? Destroy a large section of your home region then describe the mythical story.

6.3.Title: 6.3 Omen Table
Rows: Black smoke is seen rising from the tallest peak, name that peak now
Rumors begin to spread about strange sounds coming from a point in the largest ocean, name that ocean or bay now
A bright light appears, coming from the least inhabited island - name that island
Rumors begin to spread amongst the world's temples that something is wrong with the gods...
One of the world's rivers or lakes begins to change color. Name that river or lake.
A comet fills the night sky. Is this a dark omen or sign of prosperity?
For several days, birds are all seen flying away from one island. Name that island
A foul stench begins emanating from one of the Sacred Sites
At sundown, a deafening howl is heard across the world
Rumors spread the something is back...
Thousands of meteors pepper the land. What's left when the dust clears?

War.Title: War Table
Rows: Defender crushes the attacker. Defender makes an immediate counter attack against a settlement they choose. Now rolling as the attacker. Defender also places a monument to their new war hero.
Defender fights off the attackers, maintaining control of the settlement.
After many losses on both sides, the attack fails
Attacker wins and takes control of the settlement
Attacker easily overpowers the defender and takes control of the settlement, then places a new fort nearby.
Attacker crushes the enemy, then immediately makes another attack against another settlement. Create a monument to the new hero that emerged from this war.
